description: Number of composite numbers <= n and relatively prime to n.
comments: 30 is the largest number n with the property that if 1 < k < n and k is relatively prime to n, then k is prime. In other words, a(30) = 0 and if m > 30, then a(m) > 0. - _Jonathan Sondow_, Dec 08 2012
mathematica: Table[ Count[ Select[ Range[ n ], GCD[ #, n ]===1& ], q_/;!(PrimeQ[ q ]||q===1) ], {n, 180} ]
crossrefs: A048597 gives the indices where A036997(n) = 0.
author: _Wouter Meeussen_
